intro: Calcitrapa solstitialis, commonly known as the summer cress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Calcitrapa solstitialis is also valued for its edible leaves and seeds, which have been used in traditional cuisines.
